p: Spathulenol is the major compound found in our study and the mass spectrum was obtained by GCâ€“MS ( Figure 1). This compound is produced by oxidative cyclization of bicyclogermacrene ( Tran and Cramer, 2014). Spathulenol is a sesquiterpene component of essential oils in several aromatic species ( Nascimento et al., 2018) and reported with antimicrobial ( Tan et al., 2016), antiproliferative, anti-inflammatory, and immunomodulatory ( Ziaei et al., 2011) activities.
